snippet: International businesses and investors are retreating because of the prospect of a devalued currency and because consumption has plunged.
abstract: International businesses and investors are retreating from the Greek economy, wary of plunging consumption and the prospect of a devalued currency; widespread pullout means that the Greek economy will become isolated even if it does not exit the euro following the impending elections.

byline.contributor: Rachel Donadio contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: International businesses and investors are retreating because of the prospect of a devalued currency and because consumption has plunged.

headline.main: Troubled Greek Economy Is Being Left to Fend for Itself
headline.print_headline: Wary Foreign Businesses Step Back From Greece
